description: After applying updates KB5033379, KB5033375, KB5033372, and KB5033369, users experience unexpected remote code execution opportunities due to vulnerabilities in Internet Connection Sharing (ICS). Systems affected include Windows 10 builds 10.0.10240.20345, 10.0.22000.2652, and others listed in the documentation. The issue can cause unauthorized access and functionality which may severely disrupt network services, allowing malicious actors to exploit the ICS feature, compromising data integrity and system availability.
